title: Biden Picks Samantha Power to Lead USAID
sub_head: President-elect to elevate USAID administrator post to membership in White House’s National Security Council
body:
WASHINGTON—President-elect Joe Biden will nominate former journalist and ambassador to the United Nations Samantha Power to lead the U.S. Agency for International Development, transition officials said.
The president-elect will elevate the role of USAID administrator to membership in the White House’s National Security Council, the officials said.
Ms. Power won the 2003 Pulitzer Prize for her book, “A Problem From Hell,” on the U.S. policy response to genocide. She worked on the National Security Council under President Obama, then served as U.S. ambassador to the U.N. from 2013 to 2017.
“Samantha Power is a world-renowned voice of conscience and moral clarity—challenging and rallying the international community to stand up for the dignity and humanity of all people,” Mr. Biden said in a statement.
At the U.N., Ms. Power clashed with Russia over its veto of resolutions aimed at curbing the bloodshed in Syria’s civil war.
